verses.name: Job 15:1
verses.text: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,

verses.name: Job 15:2
verses.text: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?

verses.name: Job 15:3
verses.text: Should he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?

verses.name: Job 15:4
verses.text: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.

verses.name: Job 15:5
verses.text: For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.

verses.name: Job 15:6
verses.text: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.

verses.name: Job 15:7
verses.text: Art thou the first man that was born? or wast thou made before the hills?

verses.name: Job 15:8
verses.text: Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?

verses.name: Job 15:9
verses.text: What knowest thou, that we know not? what understandest thou, which is not in us?

verses.name: Job 15:10
verses.text: With us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.

verses.name: Job 15:11
verses.text: Are the consolations of God small with thee? is there any secret thing with thee?

verses.name: Job 15:12
verses.text: Why doth thine heart carry thee away? and what do thy eyes wink at,

verses.name: Job 15:13
verses.text: That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth?

verses.name: Job 15:14
verses.text: What is man, that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?

verses.name: Job 15:15
verses.text: Behold, he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.

verses.name: Job 15:16
verses.text: How much more abominable and filthy is man, which drinketh iniquity like water?

verses.name: Job 15:17
verses.text: I will shew thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;

verses.name: Job 15:18
verses.text: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it:

verses.name: Job 15:19
verses.text: Unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.

verses.name: Job 15:20
verses.text: The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.

verses.name: Job 15:21
verses.text: A dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.

verses.name: Job 15:22
verses.text: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.

verses.name: Job 15:23
verses.text: He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.

verses.name: Job 15:24
verses.text: Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.

verses.name: Job 15:25
verses.text: For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.

verses.name: Job 15:26
verses.text: He runneth upon him, even on his neck, upon the thick bosses of his bucklers:

verses.name: Job 15:27
verses.text: Because he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on his flanks.

verses.name: Job 15:28
verses.text: And he dwelleth in desolate cities, and in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps.

verses.name: Job 15:29
verses.text: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.

verses.name: Job 15:30
verses.text: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.

verses.name: Job 15:31
verses.text: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.

verses.name: Job 15:32
verses.text: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.

verses.name: Job 15:33
verses.text: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.

verses.name: Job 15:34
verses.text: For the congregation of hypocrites shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.

verses.name: Job 15:35
verses.text: They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.
